title: Task-Centered Second Language Learning Program Based on Extended Reality (XR) and Artificial Intelligence (AI)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic second-language grammar and vocabulary understanding, along with digital device proficiency
context.additional_context: Job-integrated language education program for current elementary education practitioners, operated in a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environment, with project-based assessments measuring learning outcomes.

learning_goals: By the end of the mid-term (4 weeks), learners can perform communication tasks—requesting and responding to necessary information in five daily scenarios (e.g., hospital appointments, shopping, public transportation use)—in a second language (CEFR A2–B1 level) with ≥80% accuracy
Improved language proficiency reflecting intercultural understanding in XR environments.
Development of adaptive capacity to receive personalized language feedback through interaction with AI-based conversational agents.

Through 4-week small-group collaborative activities, learners design three language teaching strategies applicable to real classroom situations (e.g., grammar explanations, role-play lessons) and receive peer feedback averaging ≥4 points on a 5-point rubric
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
